headline: Greta: Get rid of the politicians who didn't read the ObamaCare bill
subHeadline: Greta's 'Off the Record' commentary, 11/12/13: I have no sympathy for lawmakers who are now panicking about the Affordable Care Act

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.sentences: You have no clue what it really means to the American people when it's so important. This isn't naming a park. You have to do the homework and read it. Tonight, here's an idea. Just do it. Just read the bill.

utterances.speaker: REP. MIKE PENCE, R-IND.
utterances.sentences: Now they know what's in it. I would love to see some Democrats go on the record. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('tablet', 'lb4', 'tablet-tw-ad-lb4', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.sentences: They still haven't read it. Nobody's read that bill. We learned about it as these issues arise. Not every bill is read by everyone, but when it will change how we do things, you ought to read it before you vote on it. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb3', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb3', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('mobile', 'ban4', 'mobile-mw-ad-ban4', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); } We went back and counted at least 11 times I said that here ON THE RECORD. It's elementary. Read before you vote. You know what you're voting on. But those lawmakers do not deserve to be sent back to Washington, whoever they are, if they don't do basics - if they don't read and understand what they're voting for - get rid of them. Find someone who will do the job. That's my "Off the Record" comment tonight.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: You have no clue what it really means to the American people when it's so important. This isn't naming a park. You have to do the homework and read it. Tonight, here's an idea. Just do it. Just read the bill.

utterances.speaker: REP. MIKE PENCE, R-IND.
utterances.utterance: Now they know what's in it. I would love to see some Democrats go on the record.

utterances.speaker: VAN SUSTEREN
utterances.utterance: They still haven't read it. Nobody's read that bill. We learned about it as these issues arise. Not every bill is read by everyone, but when it will change how we do things, you ought to read it before you vote on it. We went back and counted at least 11 times I said that here ON THE RECORD. It's elementary. Read before you vote. You know what you're voting on. But those lawmakers do not deserve to be sent back to Washington, whoever they are, if they don't do basics - if they don't read and understand what they're voting for - get rid of them. Find someone who will do the job. That's my "Off the Record" comment tonight.
